In the context of international relations, what is the concept of "Realism" primarily focused on?
A. The inherent anarchic nature of the international system
B. The promotion of human rights and democracy
C. The importance of international institutions
D. The role of economic factors in shaping state behavior
E. None of the above

Realism in international relations is primarily focused on the inherent anarchic nature of the international system. This theory emphasizes that states operate in an environment where there is no overarching authority above them, leading them to prioritize their own security and power above all else. Realists believe that the international system is characterized by competition and conflict, and that states must be self-reliant in ensuring their survival and interests.因此，选项A是最准确的答案。
